Notes: Year 1 Months 1 – 6  from account opening

One Daily Overdraft Fee
You’ll pay a daily overdraft fee of 1p for every £7 you borrow, over your £500 fee-free amount. When calculating the daily overdraft fee, we will only use every full £7 you have borrowed, so if you borrow less than £7 you won’t be charged. 

Daily Charging
Instead of paying all fees in one go each month, any fees will be charged at the end of each day you use your overdraft – so you’ll pay for what you borrow on the day you borrow it. This will help you keep track of how much your overdraft costs you.

If you go over your limit
So all your payments are made, it’s important you manage your account within your planned overdraft limit. If you don’t have enough money in your account or you reach your limit, you may not be able to make any more payments. If a payment takes you over your limit or we stop it, you won’t be charged.

OtherEligibility.Name: Student
OtherEligibility.Description: You must be studying full time on a degree course or equivalent course of further education. The longest you can hold an account is 6 years, including the year after you finish being in full-time education. Once you stop qualifying, these conditions no longer apply. We will write to tell you about the changes to your account at least 2 months before.
Notes: To apply for a Lloyds Bank Student Account you must be studying for a full-time course that lasts for a minimum of two years or be on a one year access course leading onto a full-time degree

OtherEligibility.Name: Sole Account
OtherEligibility.Description: There are limits on the number of accounts you can have and what you can then do.

Notes: To apply for a Lloyds Bank Student Account you must be 17 or over.
To apply for a Lloyds Bank Student Account you must  have been a resident in the UK for at least three years.

FeatureBenefitItem.Name: Planned Overdraft
FeatureBenefitItem.Textual: Setting up a Planned Overdraft is free.
Notes:
In your first year, you can apply for a Planned Overdraft where there is a fee-free amount of up to: 
- £500 for the first 6 months from account opening,
- £1,000 from month 7 from account opening,
- £1,500 from month 10 from account opening.
In your second and third year, your Planned Overdraft can be up to £1,500
In your fourth year and above, your Planned Overdraft can be up to £2,000
You can find all the information you need about Planned Overdrafts for students in our Student Account welcome pack

FeatureBenefitItem.Name: It's On Us
FeatureBenefitItem.Textual:
Each month we pay back thousands of customers for something they’ve bought on their Lloyds Bank debit or credit card, up to the value of £500.
Internet Banking and It’s On Us registration required.  Must be registered for Everyday Offers and activate the offer.  Not available in Northern Ireland

FeatureBenefitEligibility.Name: It's On Us
FeatureBenefitEligibility.Textual: Internet Banking and It’s On Us registration required.  Must be registered for Everyday Offers and activate the offer.  Not available in Northern Ireland

FeatureBenefitItem.Name: Mobile Alerts
FeatureBenefitItem.Textual: Our mobile alerts are a simple and convenient way to help you stay on top of your money - if we have your mobile number, we’ll send alerts to keep you up to date on your account balance.

FeatureBenefitItem.Name: Everyday Offers
FeatureBenefitItem.Textual: Get up to 15% cashback using Everyday Offers at the type of places you regularly shop. Retailer offers and cashback amounts may vary. To be eligible for Everyday Offers you will need to be over 18, have a Lloyds Bank personal current account, a Lloyds Bank debit and/or credit card and be registered for Internet Banking.

FeatureBenefitEligibility.Name: Everyday Offers
FeatureBenefitEligibility.Textual: To be eligible for Everyday Offers you will need to be over 18, have a Lloyds Bank personal current account, a Lloyds Bank debit and/or credit card and be registered for Internet Banking.

FeatureBenefitItem.Name: ATM Withdrawals
FeatureBenefitItem.Textual: You can withdraw up to £500 a day from a Lloyds Bank Cashpoint or other cash machines. You can use your Visa debit card in over 500,000 locations in the UK and 27 million worldwide

FeatureBenefitItem.Name: Money Manager
FeatureBenefitItem.Textual: Keep track of your spending and see at a glance where your money goes with our free Internet Banking service.

FeatureBenefitItem.Name: Save the Change
FeatureBenefitItem.Textual: Register for Save the Change and make saving easy. When you buy something with your Lloyds Bank Visa debit card (and your account is in credit), the amount can be rounded up to the nearest pound, and the difference transferred to an eligible Lloyds Bank savings account.

FeatureBenefitItem.Name: Internet Banking
FeatureBenefitItem.Textual: With Internet Banking, make the most of your account 24/7.  It's the quick, easy way to keep track of your money, make payments and transfers and see your statements.

Notes: ApplePay and GooglePay: Card and account type restrictions include: Electron cards, Visa credit cards and additional credit card holders, non-personal accounts, Basic Bank Accounts and customers under 13 years.

ApplePay and GooglePay: Card and account type restrictions include: Electron cards, Visa credit cards and additional credit card holders, non-personal accounts, Basic Bank Accounts and customers under 13 years.

With Pay a Contact you can send money to friends and family quickly and securely using their UK mobile number – making it easy to split the cost of a taxi fare or to pay a friend back for dinner.

To receive payments you’ll need to register for Pay a Contact but you don’t need to register to send payments.

Our Mobile Banking app for iOS and Android are quick and easy to install, fast, convenient and more secure than ever - the easy way to stay on top of your money. Bank where you want with the latest built-in security technology that keeps your details safe and private. More and more customers are choosing the flexibility, convenience and security of banking on their mobile.
Electronic payments received from outside the UK other than by SEPA credit transfer, up to a value of £100 (including £100)
Electronic payments received from outside the UK other than by SEPA credit transfer, with a value of over £100

Non-sterling transaction fee: fee charged for the conversion of currency. This is a percentage value of your transaction. 
The amount is converted to sterling on the day it is processed by Visa using the Visa Payment Scheme Exchange Rate

Non-sterling cash fee:  fee charged to withdraw cash in a currency other than sterling, or to withdraw cash in sterling outside the UK.  The amount is converted to sterling on the day it is processed by Visa using the Visa Payment Scheme exchange rate.
Charge for Foreign Cheques paid in to the account with a sterling value of £100 or less, whether negotiating or collecting
Foreign Cheques paid in to the account with a sterling value of more than £100: our minimum charge will be £8 when we negotiate the cheque
Foreign Cheques paid in to the account with a sterling value of more than £100: our maximum charge will be £80 when we negotiate the cheque

Non-sterling purchase fee: fee charged per transaction when you make a purchase (not a cash withdrawal or purchase of foreign currency or travellers cheques). Fee is applicable only to debit card transactions. The amount is converted to sterling on the day it is processed by Visa using the Visa Payment Scheme Exchange Rate
Foreign Cheques paid in to the account with a sterling value of more than £100: our minimum charge will be £15 when we collect the cheque
Foreign Cheques paid in to the account with a sterling value of more than £100: our maximum charge will be £80 when we collect the cheque

Foreign cash fee : fee charged where you elect to allow the cash machine operator/financial service provider to make the conversion to sterling.  The provider of the foreign currency may make a separate charge for conversion.

The Correspondent Bank Fee will be payable for international payments when you select to pay all agent bank charges.  Zone 1 – USA, Canada, and Europe (non EEA).  Zone 2 – Rest of the world, excluding EEA.

OtherFeeType.Name: Correspondent Bank Fee Zone 1
OtherFeeType.Description: Zone 1 – USA, Canada, and Europe (non EEA)

Notes: The Correspondent Bank Fee will be payable for international payments when you select to pay all agent bank charges.  Zone 1 – USA, Canada, and Europe (non EEA).  Zone 2 – Rest of the world, excluding EEA.

OtherFeeType.Name: Correspondent Bank Fee Zone 2
OtherFeeType.Description: Zone 2 – Rest of the world, excluding EEA.

Notes: For Foreign Cheque values over £100: our minimum charge for each cheque paid in will be  £8 when we negotiate the cheque.
For Foreign Cheque values over £100: our maximum charge for each cheque paid in will be  £80 when we negotiate the cheque.
For Foreign Cheque values over £100: our minimum charge for each cheque paid in will be  £15 when we collect the cheque.
For Foreign Cheque values over £100: our maximum charge for each cheque paid in will be  £80 when we collect the cheque.

Notes:
Overdraft information for Under 19s, Islamic* and Basic Accounts.
Planned Overdrafts are not available on these accounts. If you do go overdrawn, you will not be charged a daily overdraft fee.

*We cannot accept new account applications for these products

11-12 year olds
A parent or guardian must be with you when you open your account or if you apply for more services. You cannot apply online and can only apply for an Under 19s account in branch. You’ll need to bring:-
Proof of ID (such as passport or birth certificate)
Proof of your parent/guardian’s identity and address (such as a utility bill dated in the last 6 months)

13-15 year olds
A parent or guardian must be with you when you open your account or if you apply for more services. Fill in our simple online application form, then pop into any Lloyds Bank branch with a parent or guardian.  You’ll need to bring:-
Proof of ID (such as passport or birth certificate)
Proof of your parent/guardian’s identity and address (such as a utility bill dated in the last 6 months)

16-17 year olds
Fill in our simple online application form, then pop into any Lloyds Bank branch. You don’t need to be accompanied by a parent or guardian, but you’ll need to bring:
Proof of ID (such as passport or birth certificate)
Proof of your parent/guardian’s identity and address (such as a utility bill dated in the last 6 months)

FeatureBenefitItem.Textual: You will earn a variable rate of interest of 1.50% AER on balances up to £2,500. You will not earn credit interest on balances of £2,500 or over. You will be paid this quarterly.

CoreProduct.ProductDescription: The easy way for children and teens to make the most of their money

Notes:
One Daily Overdraft Fee
You’ll pay a daily overdraft fee of 1p for every £7 you borrow. When calculating the daily overdraft fee, we will only use every full £7 you have borrowed, so if you borrow less than £7 you won’t be charged. 

Daily Charging
Instead of paying all fees in one go each month, any fees will be charged at the end of each day you use your overdraft – so you’ll pay for what you borrow on the day you borrow it. This will help you keep track of how much your overdraft costs you.

If you go over your limit
So all your payments are made, it’s important you manage your account within your planned overdraft limit. If you don’t have enough money in your account or you reach your limit, you may not be able to make any more payments. If a payment takes you over your limit or we stop it, you won’t be charged.
You're aged 18 or older

A resident in the UK
you’re an EU national, or have permission to stay in the UK for at least 12 months

Notes:
One Daily Overdraft Fee
You’ll pay a daily overdraft fee of 1p for every £7 you borrow, over your £100 fee-free amount. When calculating the daily overdraft fee, we will only use every full £7 you have borrowed, so if you borrow less than £7 you won’t be charged. 

Daily Charging
Instead of paying all fees in one go each month, any fees will be charged at the end of each day you use your overdraft – so you’ll pay for what you borrow on the day you borrow it. This will help you keep track of how much your overdraft costs you.

If you go over your limit
So all your payments are made, it’s important you manage your account within your planned overdraft limit. If you don’t have enough money in your account or you reach your limit, you may not be able to make any more payments. If a payment takes you over your limit or we stop it, you won’t be charged.

FeatureBenefitItem.Name: Worldwide travel insurance
FeatureBenefitItem.Textual: Multi-trip Worldwide travel cover for you and your family (includes, if eligible, your spouse, civil partner or partner and children)
Notes:
Covers certain Winter Sports
Covers UK leisure travel when two or more consecutive nights’ accommodation is booked
Comprehensive cover including:
Emergency medical cover (up to £10,000,000)
Cancellation or curtailment cover (up to £5,000)
Personal accident cover (up to £30,000)
Baggage cover (up to £2,500, £500 of which for valuables)
Travel disruption cover (up to £5,000)

Children must travel with you, your spouse, civil partner or partner or a responsible adult
The standard maximum trip duration is 45 consecutive days (for Winter Sports maximum 31 days cover in any calendar year
£40 excess may apply
Medical conditions that you and anyone to be covered have, or have had, if they are not all on the ‘No Screen Conditions’ list, must be declared and cover agreed with the insurer (there may be an additional premium if the insurer agrees to cover the condition(s))
All cover stops on your 80th birthday. As long as you are under 80 your spouse, civil partner or partner will also be covered until they reach 80

Non-sterling transaction fee: fee charged for the conversion of currency. This is a percentage value of your transaction. 
The amount is converted to sterling on the day it is processed by Visa using the Visa Payment Scheme Exchange Rate

Non-sterling cash fee:  fee charged to withdraw cash in a currency other than sterling, or to withdraw cash in sterling outside the UK.  The amount is converted to sterling on the day it is processed by Visa using the Visa Payment Scheme exchange rate.
Charge for Foreign Cheques paid in to the account with a sterling value of £100 or less, whether negotiating or collecting
Foreign Cheques paid in to the account with a sterling value of more than £100: our minimum charge will be £8 when we negotiate the cheque
Foreign Cheques paid in to the account with a sterling value of more than £100: our maximum charge will be £80 when we negotiate the cheque

Non-sterling purchase fee: fee charged per transaction when you make a purchase (not a cash withdrawal or purchase of foreign currency or travellers cheques). Fee is applicable only to debit card transactions.  If you have a Platinum debit card, we won’t charge the usual non-sterling purchase fee of £0.50 when you use it to make purchases in a foreign currency.
Foreign Cheques paid in to the account with a sterling value of more than £100: our minimum charge will be £15 when we collect the cheque
Foreign Cheques paid in to the account with a sterling value of more than £100: our maximum charge will be £80 when we collect the cheque

Foreign cash fee : fee charged where you elect to allow the cash machine operator/financial service provider to make the conversion to sterling.  The provider of the foreign currency may make a separate charge for conversion.

FeatureBenefitItem.Name: Worldwide travel insurance
FeatureBenefitItem.Textual: Multi-trip Worldwide travel cover for you and your family (includes, if eligible, your spouse, civil partner or partner and children)
Notes:
Covers certain Winter Sports
Covers UK leisure travel when two or more consecutive nights’ accommodation is booked
Comprehensive cover including:
Emergency medical cover (up to £10,000,000)
Cancellation or curtailment cover (up to £5,000)
Personal accident cover (up to £30,000)
Baggage cover (up to £2,500, £500 of which for valuables)
Travel disruption cover (up to £5,000)

Children must travel with you, your spouse, civil partner or partner or a responsible adult
The standard maximum trip duration is 45 consecutive days (for Winter Sports maximum 31 days cover in any calendar year
£40 excess may apply
Medical conditions that you and anyone to be covered have, or have had, if they are not all on the ‘No Screen Conditions’ list, must be declared and cover agreed with the insurer (there may be an additional premium if the insurer agrees to cover the condition(s))
All cover stops on your 80th birthday. As long as you are under 80 your spouse, civil partner or partner will also be covered until they reach 80

Notes: For example, if you have £4,000 in your account for one year, you'll receive an interest rate of 1.5% AER/1.49% gross variable on your entire balance, provided you pay two separate Direct Debits from your Club Lloyds current account each calendar month

CreditInterestEligibility.Name: Minimum Direct Debits
CreditInterestEligibility.Description: Must pay two separate Direct Debits from your Club Lloyds current account
CreditInterestEligibility.Textual: You must pay two separate Direct Debits from your Club Lloyds current account each calendar month

Notes:
One Daily Overdraft Fee
You’ll pay a daily overdraft fee of 1p for every £7 you borrow, over your £300 fee-free amount. When calculating the daily overdraft fee, we will only use every full £7 you have borrowed, so if you borrow less than £7 you won’t be charged. 

Daily Charging
Instead of paying all fees in one go each month, any fees will be charged at the end of each day you use your overdraft – so you’ll pay for what you borrow on the day you borrow it. This will help you keep track of how much your overdraft costs you.

If you go over your limit
So all your payments are made, it’s important you manage your account within your planned overdraft limit. If you don’t have enough money in your account or you reach your limit, you may not be able to make any more payments. If a payment takes you over your limit or we stop it, you won’t be charged.
You're aged 18 or older

Medical conditions that you and anyone to be covered have, or have had, if they are not all on the ‘No Screen Conditions’ list, must be declared and cover agreed with the insurer (there may be an additional premium if the insurer agrees to cover the condition(s))
All cover stops on your 80th birthday. As long as you are under 80 your spouse, civil partner or partner will also be covered until they reach 80

FeatureBenefitItem.Name: AA Breakdown Cover
FeatureBenefitItem.Textual: Includes Roadside Assistance, Home Start and Relay Customer covered, not the vehicle
Notes: Service is only available in the UK, Channel Islands and Isle of Man

FeatureBenefitItem.Name: Mobile phone insurance
FeatureBenefitItem.Textual:
Insures one phone on a sole account and two phones for joint accounts
Repair or replacement phone up to a maximum of £2,000 (including VAT)
Covers loss, theft, damage or breakdown (including faults)
Notes:
An Excess of £100 is payable on all successful claims .
No more than 2 successful claims per account holder in any 12 month period.

FeatureBenefitItem.Name: Card Loss Assistance
FeatureBenefitItem.Textual:
With one call day or night, Citymain can request card issuers cancel all financial cards and issue replacements where possible
You can register the cards for your family if they live with you
You can also register your passport and driving licence numbers with Citymain for easy access should you lose them

FeatureBenefitItem.Name: Everyday Offers
FeatureBenefitItem.Textual: Get up to 15% cashback using Everyday Offers at the type of places you regularly shop. Retailer offers and cashback amounts may vary. To be eligible for Everyday Offers you will need to be over 18, have a Lloyds Bank personal current account, a Lloyds Bank debit and/or credit card and be registered for Internet Banking.

FeatureBenefitEligibility.Name: Everyday Offers
FeatureBenefitEligibility.Textual: To be eligible for Everyday Offers you will need to be over 18, have a Lloyds Bank personal current account, a Lloyds Bank debit and/or credit card and be registered for Internet Banking.

FeatureBenefitItem.Name: It's On Us
FeatureBenefitItem.Textual:
Each month we pay back thousands of customers for something they’ve bought on their Lloyds Bank debit or credit card, up to the value of £500.
Internet Banking and It’s On Us registration required.  Must be registered for Everyday Offers and activate the offer.  Not available in Northern Ireland

FeatureBenefitEligibility.Name: It's On Us
FeatureBenefitEligibility.Textual: Internet Banking and It’s On Us registration required.  Must be registered for Everyday Offers and activate the offer.  Not available in Northern Ireland

FeatureBenefitItem.Name: Save the Change
FeatureBenefitItem.Textual: Register for Save the Change and make saving easy. When you buy something with your Lloyds Bank Visa debit card (and your account is in credit), the amount can be rounded up to the nearest pound, and the difference transferred to an eligible Lloyds Bank savings account.

FeatureBenefitItem.Name: Mobile Alerts
FeatureBenefitItem.Textual: Our mobile alerts are a simple and convenient way to help you stay on top of your money - if we have your mobile number, we’ll send alerts to keep you up to date on your account balance.

FeatureBenefitItem.Name: Money Manager
FeatureBenefitItem.Textual: Keep track of your spending and see at a glance where your money goes with our free Internet Banking service.

FeatureBenefitItem.Name: Joint Accounts
FeatureBenefitItem.Textual: Add a second person to your account. It’s a convenient way to share outgoings such as household bills, shopping and mortgage/rent payments or budget for holidays and special purchases.

FeatureBenefitItem.Name: ATM Withdrawals
FeatureBenefitItem.Textual: You can withdraw up to £500 a day from a Lloyds Bank Cashpoint or other cash machines. You can use your Visa debit card in over 500,000 locations in the UK and 27 million worldwide

FeatureBenefitItem.Name: Club Lloyds Banking Offers
FeatureBenefitItem.Textual:
As a Club Lloyds customer you’ll get exclusive access to offers on a range of Lloyds Bank products including:
discounted mortgage rates,
preferential savings rates,
home insurance discounts, and
a credit card offer.

FeatureBenefitItem.Name: Credit Interest
FeatureBenefitItem.Textual:
1.5% AER variable credit interest on your entire balance from £1 to £5,000
Earn variable credit interest on balances between £1 and £5,000 when you pay at least two separate Direct Debits from your Club Lloyds current account each calendar month
Notes: Club Lloyds has a £3 monthly account fee every month if you do not pay £1,500 or more into your account.

FeatureBenefitEligibility.Name: Minimum 2 Direct Debits
FeatureBenefitEligibility.Description: Minimum 2 Direct debits from Club Lloyds Account
FeatureBenefitEligibility.Textual:
You need to pay at least two separate Direct Debits from your Club Lloyds current account each calendar month.
Please note, qualifying Direct Debits must come out monthly, quarterly Direct Debits are not eligible. Also Standing Orders do not qualify.

FeatureBenefitItem.Name: Internet Banking
FeatureBenefitItem.Textual: With Internet Banking, make the most of your account 24/7.  It's the quick, easy way to keep track of your money, make payments and transfers and see your statements.

Notes: A contactless Visa debit card you can withdraw up to £500 a day at a Lloyds Bank Cashpoint or other cash machines

ApplePay and GooglePay: Card and account type restrictions include: Electron cards, Visa credit cards and additional credit card holders, non-personal accounts, Basic Bank Accounts and customers under 13 years.

ApplePay and GooglePay: Card and account type restrictions include: Electron cards, Visa credit cards and additional credit card holders, non-personal accounts, Basic Bank Accounts and customers under 13 years.

With Pay a Contact you can send money to friends and family quickly and securely using their UK mobile number – making it easy to split the cost of a taxi fare or to pay a friend back for dinner.

To receive payments you’ll need to register for Pay a Contact but you don’t need to register to send payments.

Our Mobile Banking app for iOS and Android are quick and easy to install, fast, convenient and more secure than ever - the easy way to stay on top of your money. Bank where you want with the latest built-in security technology that keeps your details safe and private. More and more customers are choosing the flexibility, convenience and security of banking on their mobile.
Electronic payments received from outside the UK other than by SEPA credit transfer, up to a value of £100 (including £100).
Electronic payments received from outside the UK other than by SEPA credit transfer, with a value of over £100.

Non-sterling transaction fee: fee charged for the conversion of currency. This is a percentage value of your transaction. 
The amount is converted to sterling on the day it is processed by Visa using the Visa Payment Scheme Exchange Rate

Non-sterling cash fee: fee charged to withdraw cash in a currency other than sterling, or to withdraw cash in sterling outside the UK.  The amount is converted to sterling on the day it is processed by Visa using the Visa Payment Scheme exchange rate.
Charge for Foreign Cheques paid in to the account with a sterling value of £100 or less, whether negotiating or collecting
Foreign Cheques paid in to the account with a sterling value of more than £100: our minimum charge will be £8 when we negotiate the cheque
Foreign Cheques paid in to the account with a sterling value of more than £100: our maximum charge will be £80 when we negotiate the cheque

Non-sterling purchase fee: fee charged per transaction when you make a purchase (not a cash withdrawal or purchase of foreign currency or travellers cheques). Fee is applicable only to debit card transactions.  If you have a Platinum debit card, we won’t charge the usual non-sterling purchase fee of £0.50 when you use it to make purchases in a foreign currency.
Foreign Cheques paid in to the account with a sterling value of more than £100: our minimum charge will be £15 when we collect the cheque
Foreign Cheques paid in to the account with a sterling value of more than £100: our maximum charge will be £80 when we collect the cheque

Foreign cash fee : fee charged where you elect to allow the cash machine operator/financial service provider to make the conversion to sterling.  The provider of the foreign currency may make a separate charge for conversion.

The Club Lloyds Platinum monthly account fee comprises of:
Platinum Account monthly account fee of £19 per month
Plus
Club Lloyds monthly account fee is Free or £3 per month.
The £3 fee is waived for each month you pay in at least £1,500 into your account.  If in any month you don't pay in this amount, you will need to pay the £3 monthly account fee.
Maximum combined monthly account fee of £22 per month.

The Correspondent Bank Fee will be payable for international payments when you select to pay all agent bank charges.  Zone 1 – USA, Canada, and Europe (non EEA).  Zone 2 – Rest of the world, excluding EEA.
